summary: This document is a monitoring alert from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein, highlighting his status as a registered sex offender and detailing various legal issues and convictions related to sexual offenses and fraud. It includes multiple references to his past legal troubles and settlements with victims. This document contains alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein, highlighting various media articles related to his legal issues and allegations of sexual misconduct. The document emphasizes the critical risk priority associated with Epstein and includes numerous references to lawsuits and media coverage surrounding his case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a financier and a registered sex offender, with a history of soliciting underage girls for prostitution and multiple legal convictions.

events.title: Conviction for Soliciting Minors
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting a minor for prostitution and was sentenced to 13 months in jail.

events.title: Release from Jail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was released after serving less than 13 months of his 18-month sentence for procuring a minor for prostitution.

events.title: Served Jail Time
events.description: Epstein served 12 months for a state charge of prostitution solicitation and registered as a sex offender.

events.title: Charged with Running a Prostitution Ring
events.description: Epstein was charged with running a ring to pay underage girls for his sexual pleasure.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a registered sex offender since 2008 after pleading guilty to soliciting prostitution.
He was convicted in Florida for soliciting an underage girl for prostitution.
By 2011, 40 underage girls had come forward with allegations against Epstein.
Epstein has made 17 out-of-court settlements as of May 2013.
He served 12 months for a state charge of prostitution solicitation in 2017.
Jeffrey Epstein is flagged with a critical risk priority by Deutsche Bank.
Numerous media articles are referenced, detailing Epstein's legal troubles and allegations of sexual misconduct.
The document includes alerts about various lawsuits filed against Epstein, including claims of sexual abuse and trafficking.
Epstein's connections to high-profile individuals, including a prince, are mentioned in the context of ongoing investigations and media scrutiny.
The document indicates that Epstein's legal issues have led to multiple lawsuits seeking damages from alleged victims.
